text: Whilst some govern their domains with benevolence and fairness, Wang Kuang prefers more.. blunt means.
When in an era of chaos, there is a fine line between cowardice and pragmatism.
It is thanks to Cao Chun that the Tiger and Leopard cavalry are so famed and feared across the Central Plains.
The world can do without Cao Hong, but it cannot do without Cao Cao!
There is no distance too far for Cao Xiu, if it means serving his family's cause.
Not even the most sagacious of strategists can penetrate Cao Zhen's tried and tested defenses.
The straight-forward nature of Cao Biao can make him too honest for his own good, at times.
As the dutiful final Empress of the Han, Cao Jie's graceful poise allows her to stand up for her husband even against her own family.
Cao Rui offers a stable hand to the state, but also one mired in expenses.
When you play the Game of Thrones, you either win, or you die.
I told you not to surrender. Now we're on the chopping board
Any foe who spies the distinctive facial hair of Cao Zhang had best prepare for a brawl.
As with many successful artists and poets in history, Cao Zhi unfortunately tends to slip into the pleasures of excess.
Guo Yuan remains unshaken and unflappable no matter what he sees, and is the type to never lose his head.
This general will not take a single step back, even if it costs him his very life.
Soldiers, no matter what comes through that gate, you will stand your ground!
This lady of the Heishan Mountains knows that the hilltops, crevices and valleys are akin to cribs and cradles, that must be protected at all costs.
Commanding a vast coalition that spreads far across the northern steppes, Tadun's name carries fear and respect to friends and foes alike.
This young cub of the Wuhuan tribes seeks to prove himself in battle and warfare, so that he may one day command his people as his father once did before him.
With almost frenzied ferocity, Wuyan recklessly rushes at anyone he even slightly believes to be a worthy challenge.
Amongst his fellow Wuhuan leaders, Supuyan stands out as being one to recognise the value of forging alliances with and winning the support of the southern warlords of the Han.
Wangdong has sworn to protect the flank of the Wuhuan tribes, no matter what force comes against him.
The fertile shores of the Daling river possesses bounties and treasure that this warrior believes will bring great prosperity to the Wuhuan.
This rider leads his horsemen from the front, and seeks nothing less than the first kill in each battle.
Crossing this one's friends, family or faction can earn a grudge than can last a lifetime.
Even after suffering indignity and humiliation, the proud Xiongnu people continue to endure.

Claiming distant descent from the Han Imperial line through the old system of princesses being sent to the Xiongnu as tribute wives, the dynamic Liu Bao patiently awaits for his family to make a mark on history.
This son of Qiangqu commands respect from fellow Xiongnu and Han officials alike.

Exiled from his own clan and home, beaten, banished and betrayed, the enterprising Yufuluo nontherless adventures across the land, seeking fame and glory. One day, perhaps this expulsed Chanyu will amass enough resources to reclaim his rightful heritage, and restore the glory of the Xiongnu...
The dutiful wife of Liu Yu is a lady who prefers negotiation and diplomacy to war and bloodshed.
It is said that the lovely wife of Han Fu has time for everyone in the court, other than her husband.
Many causes are worth dying for. Others...perhaps not so much.
The favourite daughter of Zhang Yang finds herself often at odds with her siblings, as they compete for the affection and attention of their father.
The strongwilled and firm Lady Fan acts as a balancing force amidst her family.
Those who know war also know that the layout of the land and the terrain is often the key to success and victory.
Taking a moral stand and refusing to sully your hands with violence is commendable in times of peace, but foolish in times of war.
Being a scion to a royal house can unfortunately mean your fate is under the control of other parties.
It takes a truly loyal advisor to bravely tell his lord exactly what he needs to hear, even whilst the rest of the court are looking at you with jealous glares and sharpened knives.
Even the most masterful of plans can fail if one lacks confidence or charisma to convince your lord.
To the traitorous, sometimes what goes around, comes around.
In hushed whispers, there are rumours that this lady of the Wang family is much more vicious and cruel than she seems.
Lady Wang Fangyue attempts to get her father's entire court to dance to her tune.
This daughter of Wang Kuang has an explosive temper and is as quick to anger as her father.
No distance is too far to ride for the loyal Xianyu Yin.
Sometimes, aiding one's father can prove to be a task truly insurmountable.
Some men have such flexible loyalties that not even they can remember what their goals are.
A bandit Sui Gu may be, but his loyalty and sense of honour towards his lord are still commendable.
Those who display true filiial piety must be willing to criticise their own fathers if their morals have lead them astray.
This man will not hesitate to put his body on the line for his cause, and will rather his own blood spill than give up on his duty.
Of the myriad warriors and generals of the north, few can claim to possess either the prowess or ability of Gao Lan.
Bribery and titles are meaningless trinkets to one so loyal to his family and clan.
An unfortunate and maligned illness has robbed this one of his virility and vigour.
Gongsun Kang will overcome all threats, whether internal or external, political or military, in order to maintain his firey independence.
Being at the wrong place at the wrong time can have consequences that set in motion countless unfortunate events.
The large eyes of Li Damu send chills to all who attempt to match gaze with them.
Liang Mao is willing to dispense with invaluable advice, even when threatened with blades and bondage.
Nanlou thanklessly strives to ensure the survival of his pack, even when facing disaster.
Lady Nie strives to advance the fortunes of her husband and children, above all else.
To Qu Yi, experience is everything, and reputations alone cannot carry the day.
No leader can effectively rule without a dependable, unflappable and unwavering lieutenant at his side.
With venomous poison running through his veins, this one can kill with a touch.
The mucn maligned middle child struggles to compete with his dynamic elder brother, and popular and beloved younger sibling.
Five thousand clans of Wuhuan follow Qiulijiu into battle, and angering one means making an enemy of them all.
With the thunder of hooves, the unmatchable charge of the infamous White Horse cavalry strikes fear into even the most stalwart of foes.
It would be wise to be cautious if one were to stray off the hillside path, lest one be struck down by a single bite.
The self proclaimed "yellow dragon" greedily rules over his dominion with his cruel fangs and claws.
With the manpower and resources of Liaodong and the far northeast at his back, Gongsun Yuan stakes his own claim as king.
Yan Rou maintains good relations with the peoples beyond the northern borders, and uses his knowledge of their ways and culture to help maintain an uneasy peace.
Beloved by her father, Zhang Shangxiu is disarmingly popular amongst the commonfolk and gentry alike, and prefers diplomacy to bloodshed.
Lady Zhang Xiangyang has been trained with swords and spears since she was a young girl, and it is a common sight to see her riding to battle alongside her father.
When in an era of chaos, there is a fine line between cowardice and pragmatism.
The Yang clan has thrived, endured and prospered in eras of turmoil, and will continue to do so. As one of the clan's most dignified members, Yang Biao is no exception to this.
This wickedly ambitious noblewoman will do whatever it takes to ensure her beloved son's rise and succession.
No matter what she desires and wishes for, her wicked father shall provide.
Even when surrounded by bickering former comrades, drawing blades over petty differences, this one attempts to keep the peace.
Beware, for the spirits of the dead can be restless to unjust murderers.
Even the most clever of strategists still require men of muscle and prowess to carry out their schemes.
Lady Yan is not afraid to speak her mind in private, and does not mind who she may offend.
This officer is eager to learn dirty tricks, from the most brutal of mentors.
When one can persuade a friend to slay his own adopted father not once, but twice, then it can truly be proved that foul words can cause Empires to fall.
Lo, your majesty, wait! I shall deliver you from these rebels!
Li Jue and his clan are not above using threats and violent beatings to get what they desire.
Niu Fu uses both violence and influence to place himself at the head of a cabal of likeminded individuals.
What use is loyally serving a man, if it causes your wife and son to be stolen by another?
Wang Fang's loyalties are akin to a leaf on a storm.
Xu Rong may seem like a rather ordinary man, and one of few words, but he will get the job done with unrivalled efficiency.
Zhang Ji maintains an air of dignity and honour, even among his more thuggish allies.
Often, caution will be tossed to the wind, when the position of foes needs to be scouted.
Cheng Yin has many friends among the western tribes, and is quick to rally them to his cause.
Chenggong Ying shall never forget the kindness of past masters, nor shall he forget the choices that lead him to the present, as both are key to a bright future.
The beautiful Han Anyue is just as rebellious and opportunistic as her father.
Like a hidden viper, this one lurks until the prime moment to strike.
This son of Han Sui serves his father by performing as a liason to the myriad western tribes and clans.
Hou Xuan seeks the glory of the first kill, and the dignity of being the last man to flee.
The lucrative western traderoutes are well defended by this brave warlord.
Whenever the western lands are in peril, Liang Xing shall always be there to answer the call to arms.
Allowing his fellow western warriors to charge, Ma Wan instead opts to hold the line.
The prowling western tigeress will bring a swift end to those who dare enter her territory.
The honourable countenance of Yang Qiu is inspiring to the men of Anding.
Zhang Heng's dynamic enthusiasm causes him to stand out even amongst the rest of Han Sui's Eight.
Let no man doubt the quality and skill of Yan Xing, whose fame as a warrior is unmatched in the west.
The gregarious Bi Jieyan shares her generous bounty to all those in need.
The scholarly son of Fu Xie skillfully acts as a go between from the Han court, to the western warlords.
The charming Lady Yang is friendly to all, but in an era of turmoil, being open and trusting can oft lead to peril and disaster...
Li Xiu uses honeyed words and allegory alike to nudge his warlord one direction or another.
There are few things under the Heavens that can evoke more fear, than being on the wrong end of stampeding cavalry.
Above all else, Ma Xiu is a proud advocate for the might and merits of his family.
The primary calling for Yan Pu is the long term survival of the Five Pecks sect, even if it means persuasing his master to bend the knee.
Yang Ang's defences will forever stand firm - against a direct assault, at least.
Even a middling general can hold the narrow routes into Hanzhong from a frontal attack.
Yang Song cares about two things in this world. Money, and Yang Song.
The wars of the land mean little to Zhang Fu, who devotes his time to spreading his father's teachings, and raising alms for the poor.
Each devoted to the teachings of the Way must donate five pecks of rice, which are then stored and given to the hungry and needy.
Ever more a military mind than his theocratic brother, Zhang Wei strives to keep the peace and protect the followers of the Five Pecks sect.
Poems of "great harmony, but lacking strength" are the specialty of this famed literary artist of the Ying clan.
An envious and dissatisfied general can lead to the downfall of a state, if he is not dealt with.
Although his advice may seem harsh, Huang Quan's words sing with carefully considered wisdom.
This dignified matriarch often acts as a spokesperson for the wants and needs of the Dongzhou clique.
Not one for war or politics, this lady would rather tend to the needs of her family than get herself involved in anything reckless.
Wu Xian is a model gentlewoman - kind, just and loyal.
Lei Tong does have a knack for breaking through the formations of his opponents, but this comes with impetuous recklessness.
Every parent laments and wails for a sickly and weak child.
When his clan is threatened, this one will hold out, no matter the cost.
Pang Xi truly knows what is best for the family of his old friend Liu Yan, even if they do not appreciate his efforts.
As scholarly and learned Peng Yang may be, his arrogance and smug rudeness puts off colleague and master alike.
Swiftness is a key tenant of victory, and Wu Ban knows this well.
The stern patriarch of the Wu clan has drilled important notions of loyalty and dignity into his younger relatives.
Traitors and rebels beware, as Wu Yi is commanding the van!
Against the loyal Zhang Ren, not a single foe shall pass.
By penning the histories of local worthies, one can impart wisdom to future generations.
Even as countless winters pass him by, Yan Yan is no less weathered.
Even when far seperated from his clan, this one will still admirably perform the duties his family expects of him.
In eras of turmoil, even the humble filer of scrolls can be implicated in plots against the state.
Zhao Wei, a respected member of Yizhou's gentry, believes the province's fate should remain in the hands of the locals, and certainly should not be leveraged to violent refugees from the north.
We don't want any of those filthy easterners, coming to Yizhou, taking our jobs!
Consider this one the first to light the torches of war, and set alight the flames of rebellion.
This respected lady comes from a local clan well versed in the politics of Jianwei, and hold strategic and political interests on both banks of the river.
It is claimed that Dong Fu will praise even the smallest of a man's virtues, but likewise criticise his mildest faults.
The cunning old minister Wang Yun embraces the dark and dastardly if it means preserving the ways he thinks are right.
The quiet Yuan Yao keeps his head down, rather than getting involved in his father's ambitious schemes.
This general has tossed aside the tenants of the Art of War in favour of a more direct approach.
This warrior has sworn a vow to hold the line, regardless of the cost.
Chen Lan steals from the rich, then keeps it for himself. He also steals from the poor.
Lei Xu raises the flag of resistance, and waves it until his last breath.
The things I could do, if I had a little money, in a rich man's world.
Yang Hong retains his loyalty to his lord, even when all of his wisdom is ignored.
When disaster strikes a family, someone has to do the responsible thing and step up.
Unlike his brother, Kuai Liang prefers to keep his hands free of blood, and seeks a path of peace.
No ploy is too underhanded to further Kuai Yue's goals.
The fates of an entire province are wrapped around this alluring lady's fingers.
Lou Gui will summon fortifications from the air itself,  but he expects to be rewarded…
Like a cliff standing against crashing waves, Wen Pin stands resolute.
When a sagacious man speaks words of wisdom, only a fatuous fool would ignore him.
This aggressive king will be the first in the fray in an offensive battle, knowing his men will always follow him.
The leader of Baekje highly experienced in swift and aggressive campaigns, and the storming of fortresses.
By seeking out men of merit and providing fair relief for the needy, this king understands the importance of laying foundations for a prosperous future.
The waters of the great river shall flow with the blood of any who dare face Chen Jiu in naval combat.
Even the raging rivers can give way to moments of tranquility.
Amongst the maelstrom of chaos, there are some who attempt to carve out a humble life of peace and quiet.
This aggressive son of the Huang clan strikes out against his clan's adversaries with the force, and indeed, the predictablility of the tides.
As the rising dragon soars, this one does all she can to assist his ascent to the heavens.
The unstoppable waters of the great river shall wash away any who defy this lady's family.
Even the mightiest hero can fall to a well placed arrow. Or a boulder to the head, for that matter.
Su Fei's knowledge of the riverways is only rivalled by his fierce loyalty to his friends.
Mastering the waterways of China takes years of training, this officer has reached a degree of expertise.
Come, rebels, and taste the blade of Bao Xin!
An acidic tongue rarely wins friends in an age of war.
For whatever reason, this nobleman fancies himself a spy, of sorts.
The Cai clan pat themselves on the back for both their naval prowess, and the complexity of their tricky ploys.
Sometimes, governors simply do whatever is required of them.
Of all the civil officials under the heavens, Cai Zan is certainly one of them.
This officer enjoys playing detective. Whether or not he is effective has yet to be seen.
In order to survive the difficult and dangerous game of clan politics, often a lady requires a more subtle approach.
Chang Xi's morality and loyalty change course as often as a reed getting blown by a strong gust.
Sometimes, just sometimes, power fails to corrupt, and instead leads to altruism and charity.
This man's gifts were noted at a young age and he continues to blossom, as if perpetually held in spring's sweet bloom.
You can call it inherited ability or mere nepotism, depending on the level of your cynicism.
Chen Ying has an expertise in the use of throwing weapons, a niche that allows him to stand somewhat tall amongst other warriors.
Cheng Yu knows that even the most unthinkable actions can become unavoidable in times of war.
Cui Lie is so willing to encourage corruption that his very being reeks of copper coins.
Huang Wan is the very model of a modern minister general.
The venerable Lady Gan has experienced much that this world has to offer, both its pleasures and its hardships.
As a noblewoman of the royal house of Liu, this lady expects both respect and luxury.
A lady with social connections and a knack to manage her family's accounts is a crucial addition to any clan.
This one has a single goal that is rather simple to understand - she seeks to accumulate vast amounts of wealth for herself, and her family.
With a polite smile and pleasant conversation, this lady knows how to keep her guests well looked after.
It is the curse of the trusting to be magnanimous, generous, and ultimately tricked.
Even an act as simple as a smuggled orange can be proof of one's steadfast loyalty and love to their kin.
The reliable Lu Jun does not back down from opponents on either the battlefield, or the political arena.
If one wishes to learn the intricacies of gentlemanly behaviour, one need look no further.
Being born to a vast family can feed either vice or virtue. Luckily, this one is kind to a fault, but it could've gone either way.
This one earned merits at a young age for his bravery and defiance when faced with adversary.
The steadfast and loyal Mi Fang is a general you can always assume will protect your back whilst you leave on an offensive. Almost always, at least.
Humility and modesty are among the key tenets of being a respected Confucian gentleman.
Let none dispute the Babyfaced Bandit's commitment and loyalty to his band of brothers, and to the people of Taishan.
Sun Shao may not shine brightly amongst his peers, but his reliability, efficiency and work behind the scenes are truly invaluable.
Is it too much to ask to wish for a simple, civilian life, even as the world around you falls apart?
Many mediocre children in the land benefit greatly from nepotism. The mostly ignored Tao Ying is not one of them.
This one is a master of charming and shrewd conversation.
There are unfortunately those who struggle to perform well in roles they have been promoted to.
Every lord should seek to employ wise men willing to give good, honest advice.
Amongst the storms of chaos engulfing the land, Xu Jing is one of many scholar attempting to find a place of safe refuge.
Ying Shao makes it his life's work to complile the way of life of the people and rituals of the Han in encyclopedic detail.
Chaos is a ladder, and one Zang Ba is well equipped to climb.
Zang Hong may outwardly appear to be a typically handsome and polite fellow, but this gentleman harbours a passionate fire within.
When the locals are reluctant to present their tribute, this one is sent to ensure they are more "charitable."
Ze Yue helps further her family's cause through her skills at manipulation and trickery.
Zhang Miao has friends everywhere. It's a shame they all hate each other.
Zhang Yun commands fleets with a cool head, and knowledge of the flows of the water.
Come, there is no need for violence! Let us share tea, and discuss this matter like gentlemen.
Being the only son of the famous Zheng Xuan carries certain expectations. Zheng Yan does not allow his family name to get to his head, and modestly acts as a good filial child should.
Even when serving in an administrative role, Zhou Ang knows full well the importance of a well mustered militia and a well stocked armoury.
Tales of Zhou Xin's bravery and capabilities have spread far beyond his homeland in the far south.
A man of truly pure character will refuse to be recruited by a regime they do not believe in, even if it puts them at personal risk.
Just as greatness lies just out of reach above, a disastrous downfall lurks below.
The easy-going Liu Cong is happy enough to allow advisors and relatives more willful than he tell him exactly what to do.
When his allies call for aid, Chen Wen is the first to raise his banner and muster his armies.
Zhu Hao maintains a cool head and calm demeanour, no matter what the world throws his way.
Even young dragons require a safe home to grow and hone their abilities.
Zhang Xian's scorching flames of defiance are not so easily snuffed out.
This governor taps into occult rituals and what he believes is magic in an attempt to overawe people into following his commands.
The energetic Liu Pan overcomes the odds with raids, indirect attacks and a knack for guerilla warfare.
This warrior's destructive temper is akin to a thunderstorm, and his aggressive charges resemble a fierce gale.
With a fair hand and benevolent policies, Lai Gong seeks to nurture and protect those under his care.
The young Luo Tong embodies what it means to be a filial son, and carries himself with genuine respect to the needy, kindness to the poor, and diligence in regards to his duties.
The eager and brave Xiahou Ba personally forges a path for his army. He almost never gets lost. Almost.
The flamboyant Mi Heng will abrasively tell you  all the brutal honesties you didn't want to hear, all whilst banging a drum. Naked. There is little anyone can do in the face of such audacity.
The line between order and disorder lies in logistics.
No matters from within or without escape the authoritarian gaze of Sima Shi.
Every person on the street knows what's on Sima Zhao's mind.
Woe betide any man who dare cross Wang Yi or her family.
Pan Feng is an utterly unstoppable warrior, peerless beneath the Heavens! If only he didn't have a cold. Or cramp. Or a stomach ache.
Kuitou clings onto power by his very fingertips, as external and internal pressures put a strain on his leadership of his clan.
With 100,000 riders at his back, Kebineng sets the north ablaze.
This chieftain is the heir to Tanshihuai's legacy, and dreams to rebuild the mighty confederation of his grandfather.
With bow and blade, Budugen terrorizes the people of the frontier.
The warriors of the Xianbei are renowned for being far more ferocious and tenacious than even the best of the Xiongnu and Wuhuan.
This canny chief recognises the value of trade and diplomacy as being just as important as strength and warfare.
Maintaining good relations and trade between the various northern clans and tribes is essential to establish any form of cohesion and cooperation.
Many of the steppe riders learned how to ride almost before they learned how to walk.
The intrepid gaze of the adventurous Tuoba Jiefen extends ever onwards, over the horizon and into the future.
This wise chieftain has lead the Tuoba clan through trial and tribulation, migrating his people over great distances to find lands of safety and prosperity.
None can stop the momentum of Tufa Pigu!
A masterful commander is one who can observe all aspects of a battlefield.
When there's something strange, in the palace halls, who're you gonna call? Zhong Yao!
One day you'll see, you'll all see!
The perceptive Wang Yuanji is a lady who will always go above and beyond her duties.
Zhang Chunhua's wit and wisdom are every bit a match for the greatest of scholars.
Unmatched in martial arts in her home county, it is said that the bold and beautiful Ban Sanniang will only marry a man able to defeat her in single combat.
Guan Xing has heavy footsteps to follow and a lot to prove, and is eager to show his worth and ability.
The charming and gregarious Guan Suo has no issue attracting others wherever he goes.
Whether it be building castles or upholding the law, Man Chong never takes half measures.
The calculating Jia Chong dirties his own hands, so his superior does not have to.
An astute and capable administrator, Jia Kui runs his office with military precision and discipline.
The humble and soft spoken Li Dian is careful and thoughtful in all matters of war and administration alike.
Fear not, for Liu Feng will surely arrive soon to rescue us!
Let none question the pride and loyalty of Guan Ping.
Known for being an expert general despite his inexperience, Jiang Wei has a precocious talent for war.
Some men enjoy the simpler pleasures of life, rather than trying to apply themselves or improve the world for the better.
Deng Ai will climb every mountain, ford any stream, follow any rainbow, until he finds his dream.
The wise words of Xin Xianying always help steer those who listen onto the path of righteousness.
With a distinctive plume of white and a majestic countenance, Chen Dao strikes a dashing figure on the battlefield.
Not one for fancy schemes, Song Xian prefers to take on problems the only way he knows how - head on.
This warrior surges into the fray, with bold quickness and reckless abandon.
For the sake of his comrades, this general holds on until the bitter end.
Cao Xing's skills are so sharp, they'll put an eye out.
With the presence of a monarch, and the dignity and composure to match, Guo Nüwang commands respect from all of those who hear her words.
Guo Tu's advice is always the same: attack!
Everyone has a plan until a Xianbei stabs you in the face.
Ruthlessly competitive, Pang Ji will employ whatever dirty trick he can to come out on top.
*The steadfast and brilliant Tian Yu displays both valor and ingenuity in equal measure.
I have a cunning plan, my lord...
Zao Zhi knows that all kingdoms are founded upon two things: the people and the land.
The jovial Jueji always has a jolly grin on his face, even when in the heat of battle.
Agui's stalwart resolve is as unmovable as the mighty mountains that he calls home.

The network of mountains, rivers and valleys that the Di people call their home is a labyrinth that can halt the march of even an experienced general. To be a chieftain of a Di tribe, one must know this geographical maze better than even the back of one's own hand.
This princess of the Di people proves that she is every bit as capable and deadly as any man of her clan.
The very ground trembles before the tenacious prowess of Yang Qianwan!
The mountains and plateaus of China are home to some of the most rugged, fiercely independent and ferocious warriors imaginable.
You're getting cursed! And you're getting cursed, and you're getting cursed! Everyone here's getting cursed!
Dare you enter my magical realm?!
When the sagacious yet strict Hua Tuo tells you to rest and take your medication, you had best pay heed!
This official governs carefully amidst a maelstrom of intrigue, mindful of the creeping ambition of those around him.
To be a noble landowner on the fractured frontier requires courage and strength of arms, as well as social savvy and wits.
The staunch and headstrong Huang Hua stands in defiance of any adversary - regardless of the wisdom of his decision.

Ma Ai has spent his life dutifully safeguarding the crucial Hexi Corridor and protecting the lucrative western trade routes. To him, the lords of the Central Plains are petty bickerers, and he does not consider their wars to be worth either his time or hassle, not when the roads of commerce need defending.
A man's convictions are only as sharp as his sword.
Between allying with tribes, reopening trade, putting down rebellions and advising the court, Su Ze is an official of truly tireless efforts.
With a flick of his pen, this one brings artistry to parchment.
Even when the city is surrounded, even when the walls are stormed and the gates are breached, Wei Kang will hold the line, come what may.
When law and order break down, wandering swordsmen take up arms with their own mantle of justice, be that for good or ill.
Your head is as empty as a Eunuch's undergarments.
Those of true character and loyalty stay the course through thick and thin.
Whilst the shrines and temples of his late father Zhang Huan are revered by the people of Wuwei, the less-than-worthy Zhang Meng does not enjoy such praise.
Ordinary men often sadly have to endure lives of malaise and misfortune, when the gales of disharmony sweep the world.
The strong men of the Zhao family are dead, leaving only a weak daughter. I need not worry. - The last words of the murderous fool who crossed the brave Zhao E.
A little rebellion every now and then is a good thing.
This county ain't big enough for the two of us!
Hooray! We did it! We saved the commandery!
This official knows the value of biding time, making local contacts and forging alliances, but must be mindful of the blurred line between caution and hesitation.
Let none underestimate the long-lasting fealty of Liao Hua.
If you can't run with the big dogs, stay beneath your rock.
Every dog has its day...
Alright! Everything's coming up Xu He!
Nothing personal, child.
Storm the city, lads! Slaughter anything that gets in your way!
Be they colleague or Emperor, the truly honest and righteous advisor cares not who he criticizes.
So this is your wife? Why don't you please take a stool right there.
The brave Cao Anmin shows all the virtues of a filial man, putting his elders first despite any faults they may have.
The head of the noble Quan clan has envible vim and vigour.
No matter the threat or danger, Zhang Nan will be there, willing to gallantly surrender his own life if it means protecting his lord.
I soiled my armour, I was so scared...!
Blue? No, no, my favourite colour is yellow. Mayhaps you are thinking of some other Zhou Yu?
If you cannot handle the high temperatures, then it is best that you vacate the cooking area.
By instigating uprisings on the enemy's homefront, their frontlines can become that much more stretched.
Without an advisor of this caliber at your side, a chance for hegemony seems impossible.
A noble spirit embiggens the smallest man.
Wisdoms pours from every word of this able, if inexperienced, counsellor.
I have the constant fear that something's always there.
You think you can bribe me? Do I look like I can be bribed?
*"Set! Loose! Fire the catapults!"
Once you are in this archer's sights, you are as good as dead.
The presence of this Wuhuan princess causes her enemies to tremble and stall, as if they are facing a bitter blizzard blowing from the north.
In another life, they could've been best friends. However, that's just not how the bones fell…
Here he comes, to save the day!

Today we need a state of militiamen, common folk not only prepared to take up arms, but folk who regard duty to their lord as the basic purpose of their daily life and who are willing to consciously work and sacrifice for that duty.
Doctor, doctor, please, oh the mess I'm in...
Let's end this, right here and right now! I'll show you just how defiant Han loyalists can be!
Beware of old men in a world where heroes die young.
Oh, you may not have the looks, you may not have the cash, but you'll win yourself some loot, if you only got a moustache.
He'll stab you in the back as soon as he gets the chance, but until then Hao Meng's dirty tricks can be most useful.
Jue Jiejie lives a modest life and puts the plight of the poor above all else, despite her own status and comforts.
But who watches the watchmen? And who watches those who watch the watchmen? And who watches those who-
There is a fine line between bravado and foolishness.

Whether with civil or military affairs, Teng Zhou's attention to detail is second to none.
